result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis E Meza Juarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court will grant 150 days credit IF revoked

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. 
Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. 
No use or possession of any controlled substnaces without a valid prescription. 
No use or possession of CBD products.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
No contact with victim from 19CF940, A.C.O.
While in custody there are no restrictions on contact with victim, Y.C.D. 
When defendant is released there is to be no contact with victim, Y.C.D. unless she consents and the Agent agrees.
Domestic Violence counseling if deemed appropriate by agent. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
